instance.name: Preconfigured dynamics in the hippocampus are guided by embryonic birthdate and rate of neurogenesis
instance.citation: Huszár, Roman; Zhang, Yunchang; Blockus, Heike; Buzsáki, György (2023) Preconfigured dynamics in the hippocampus are guided by embryonic birthdate and rate of neurogenesis (Version 0.230630.2304) [Data set]. DANDI archive. https://doi.org/10.48324/dandi.000552/0.230630.2304

affiliation.name: New York University Langone Medical Center
New York University Langone Medical Center
New York University Langone Medical Center

instance.description: The incorporation of novel information into the hippocampal network is likely be constrained by its innate architecture and internally generated activity patterns. However, the origin, organization, and consequences of such patterns remain poorly understood. Here, we show that hippocampal network dynamics are affected by sequential neurogenesis. We birthdated CA1 pyramidal neurons with in-utero electroporation over 4 embryonic days encompassing the peak of hippocampal neurogenesis, and compared their functional features in freely moving, adult mice. Neurons of the same birthdate displayed distinct connectivity, coactivity across brain states, and assembly dynamics. Same birthdate hippocampal neurons were topographically organized, in that anatomically clustered (<500µm) neurons exhibited overlapping spatial representations. Overall, the wiring and functional features of CA1 pyramidal neurons reflected a combination of birthdate and the rate of neurogenesis. These observations demonstrate that sequential neurogenesis in embryonic development shapes the preconfigured forms of adult network dynamics.

measurementTechnique.name: multi electrode extracellular electrophysiology recording technique

relatedResource.name: Preconfigured dynamics in the hippocampus are guided by embryonic birthdate and rate of neurogenesis
